definitions.definition: (often followed by "in"): To yield to a temptation or desire.
definitions.example: He looked at the chocolate but didn't indulge.

definitions.definition: To satisfy the wishes or whims of.
definitions.example: Grandma indulges the kids with sweets.

definitions.definition: To give way to (a habit or temptation); not to oppose or restrain.
definitions.example: to indulge sloth, pride, selfishness, or inclinations

definitions.definition: To grant an extension to the deadline of a payment.
To grant as by favour; to bestow in concession, or in compliance with a wish or request.
Having had all desires, wishes, and whims granted; having been brought up lavishly, wanting for nothing.
